intro: Thalictrum expansum subsp. virgultorum, commonly known as the broadleaf meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread and form dense colonies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland and riparian ecosystems.
